questions.prompt: 1. In BG 14.1, what wisdom does Krishna say will liberate one from all miseries?
choices: Knowledge of the three modes of material nature
questions.feedback: Krishna will explain the three modes of material nature and how to transcend them.

questions.prompt: 2. In BG 14.3, what is Brahman?
choices: The womb where all beings are born; My energy is the seed-giving father
questions.feedback: Krishna identifies Himself as the father and the material and spiritual energies as the mother.

questions.prompt: 3. In BG 14.4, what are the three modes of material nature?
questions.feedback: All material manifestations are produced by the three modes of material nature.

questions.prompt: 4. In BG 14.5-7, what is the mode of goodness characterized by?
choices: Purity, knowledge, happiness, and freedom from sinful reaction
questions.feedback: Goodness is pure, illuminating, and leads to happiness and knowledge.

questions.prompt: 5. In BG 14.7, what is the mode of passion characterized by?
choices: Unlimited desires and attachment; it is the cause of endless hankering
questions.feedback: Passion creates endless desires, attachments, and thirst for enjoyment.

questions.prompt: 6. In BG 14.8, what is the mode of ignorance characterized by?
choices: Darkness, illusion, madness, and confusion of all knowledge
questions.feedback: Ignorance causes delusion, madness, inertia, and obscures all knowledge.

questions.prompt: 7. In BG 14.9-10, what happens when goodness predominates?
choices: Illumination develops; one becomes happy and attains knowledge
questions.feedback: Predominance of goodness leads to happiness, light, and understanding.

questions.prompt: 8. In BG 14.10, what occurs when passion predominates?
choices: Unlimited desires and attachment; one becomes bound by fruitive actions
questions.feedback: Passion creates attachment to results and binds one in the cycle of action.

questions.prompt: 9. In BG 14.11, what results from the predominance of ignorance?
choices: Madness, inertia, and negligence; one loses consciousness and intelligence
questions.feedback: Ignorance produces dullness, sleep, and loss of proper understanding.

questions.prompt: 10. In BG 14.13-14, what is the result for those in each mode at the time of death?
choices: All go to the same place
Those in goodness go higher; those in passion stay in the same; those in ignorance go lower
questions.feedback: One's nature at death determines one's destination and next birth.

questions.prompt: 11. In BG 14.15, what is the result of transcending the three modes?
choices: Freedom from birth, death, disease, and all suffering; immortality
questions.feedback: Transcending the modes grants liberation from rebirth and all material miseries.

questions.prompt: 12. In BG 14.17, who is the supreme among the modes?
choices: Goodness; it is the purest and the most illuminating
questions.feedback: Goodness is the highest mode, but transcending all three leads to the Supreme.

questions.prompt: 13. In BG 14.18, what characteristic do those who are beyond the modes display?
choices: They neither hate nor desire the modes; they are steady
questions.feedback: Those beyond the modes remain neutral, neither craving nor rejecting the experiences.

questions.prompt: 14. In BG 14.19, what is required to transcend the three modes?
choices: Unconditional devotional service and love for Krishna
questions.feedback: Transcendence comes through pure devotional service to Krishna.

questions.prompt: 15. In BG 14.20, what is the nature of those who transcend the modes?
choices: Brahmi sthitihâ€”they are established in the transcendental state of Brahman
questions.feedback: Those beyond the modes achieve the state of being established in Brahman consciousness.

questions.prompt: 16. In BG 14.4-8 (from purport), why are the three modes called the gunas?
choices: Guna means quality or mode; they qualify matter and determine all experiences
questions.feedback: The modes or gunas are qualities that characterize material nature and all material manifestations.

questions.prompt: 17. In BG 14.12-14 (from purport), how do the modes influence one's next life?
choices: The predominant mode at death determines the nature of the next birth
questions.feedback: One's consciousness and mode at the time of death determines one's next destination.

questions.prompt: 18. In BG 14.15-20 (from purport), why is goodness superior even among the modes?
choices: Because it leads to knowledge and gradually to transcendence
questions.feedback: Goodness is superior because it leads toward transcendence and Krishna consciousness.

questions.prompt: 19. In BG 14.18-19 (from purport), what is the path for those in each mode?
choices: Those in good develop knowledge; those in passion must work off attachment; those in ignorance must struggle upward
questions.feedback: Different paths exist depending on which mode predominates in one's nature.

questions.prompt: 20. In BG 14.6 (from purport), what is the symptom of living in goodness?
choices: Peace, knowledge, and freedom from sinful reactions
questions.feedback: Goodness brings clarity, virtue, and spiritual understanding.

questions.prompt: 21. In BG 14.7 (from purport), what is the nature of passion's attraction?
choices: It is temporary and creates endless hankering and frustration
questions.feedback: Passion creates temporary satisfaction followed by endless thirst for more.

questions.prompt: 22. In BG 14.8 (from purport), how does ignorance affect consciousness?
choices: It clouds judgment and obscures knowledge and truth
questions.feedback: Ignorance creates darkness of mind and prevents understanding of reality.

questions.prompt: 23. In BG 14.19 (from purport), what is unique about Krishna devotion as a means to transcend?
choices: It directly lifts one beyond all modes through pure love and service
questions.feedback: Krishna consciousness directly transcends all material modes through devotional service.

questions.prompt: 24. In BG 14.20 (from purport), what is Brahmi sthitih or the state of Brahman?
choices: A transcendental state beyond material qualities; eternal, blissful consciousness
questions.feedback: Brahmi sthitih is the eternal liberated state of transcendental consciousness.

questions.prompt: 25. In BG 14 (summary), what is the main teaching?
choices: Understanding and transcending the three modes through devotion leads to liberation
questions.feedback: Chapter 14 teaches how to recognize, work with, and ultimately transcend the material modes.
